name: For 'Blues Brothers' Diehards, Part 5 Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to the Illinois State Police, the Bluesmobile is what make of vehicle?
questions.explanation:
Dodge.

	We hear one of the troopers refer to it as a 1974 Dodge sedan.

questions.text: After the Illinois State Police car carrying Burton Mercer (John Candy) crashes into the side of a moving semi-truck, Mercer asks the officers what the designation of their car is before calling in for help via radio. What car is Mercer in?
questions.explanation:
Car 55.

	Mercer: 'Hi, there. This is Car 55. We're in a truck.'

questions.text: The head of the 'Illinois Nazis' is in one of the cars chasing Jake (John Belushi) and Elwood (Dan Aykroyd) as the Blues brothers close in on their destination. Thanks to some physics-defying stunts, though, the Nazis' car drives off the edge of an incomplete bridge. What color is the Nazis' car?
questions.explanation:
red.

	'I've always loved you' are the last words spoken by the driver of that ill-fated red car.

questions.text: True or False: Elwood Blues is the only character we see driving the Bluesmobile throughout the film.
questions.explanation:
true & t & yes & y.

	Elwood is apparently quite the stunt driver.

questions.text: When the Blues brothers finally arrive at the State Building, they ask the ground floor security guards what room the Cook County Assessor's office is in. What room number are they given?
As Jake and Elwood ride the elevator up to the office of the Cook County Assessor, what 'elevator music' song is heard?
options: 'The Boogie-Woogie Bugle Boy From Company B'
questions.explanation:
'The Girl From Ipanema'.

	Writer-director Kevin Smith made an amusing reference to this scene in 'Mallrats': the same song is heard in the mall elevator.

questions.text: The man playing the part of the Cook County Assessor is more famous as a director than as an actor. Which of the following films has this man directed?
questions.explanation:
'The Sugarland Express'.

	Steven Spielberg played the Assessor. 'The Sugarland Express' (1974) was the first theatrical release he directed.

questions.text: The Blues brothers state outright the location of the orphanage they are trying to save once they hand the money over to the Cook County Assessor. In what city or township is the orphanage located?
questions.explanation:
Calumet City.

	Sibley is about five miles north of Calumet City. West Chicago is, as one might guess, a far west suburb. South Chicago, to the best of my knowledge, is not an actual city or township in Illinois.

questions.text: Once the Blues Brothers Band has been incarcerated, we see them performing in prison as The It's Never Too Late To Mend Band. During their performance of 'Jailhouse Rock,' one of the prisoners jumps up on a table and dances wildly. The man playing this prisoner was a member of which popular 70's band?
questions.explanation:
The Eagles.

	Yes, that was Joe Walsh doing a jig atop that table.

questions.text: We only get to see the eyes of Jake (unobscured by sunglasses) once during the film. (NOTE: This question applies to the original theatrical release, not the 'Special Edition' or any other alternate release.)
questions.explanation:
true.

	Jake removes his glasses in the storm drain in order to pacify Camille (Carrie Fisher).
